item.title: A first post
item.description: Hi, I'm the here-bot cat! Use me to find your way in your website. Here I am: content/blog/spoonful-series/01-spoonful.md To remove me, delete this line inside that file: {{< here >}} My content section is: blog My layout is: single-series does this work? or this? Let’s start. beginning middle end

item.title: A second post
A third post
item.description: Hi, I'm the here-bot cat! Use me to find your way in your website. Here I am: content/blog/spoonful-series/03-spoonful/index.markdown Here is my R Markdown source file: blog/spoonful-series/03-spoonful/index.Rmarkdown You'll want to edit this file, then re-knit to see the changes take effect in your site preview. To remove me, delete this line inside that file: {{< here >}} My content section is: blog My layout is: single-series Images in this page bundle: /blog/spoonful-series/03-spoonful/featured-photo.

item.title: A Spoonful of Hugo
item.description: ** No content below YAML for the series _index. This file is a leaf bundle, and provides settings for the listing page layout and sidebar content.**

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.

item.title: Kari Norman
item.description: Formspree makes it easy to receive submissions from HTML forms on your static website. Functional Form This theme has a form-to-email feature built in, thanks to the simple Formspree integration. All you need to activate the form is a valid recipient email address saved in the front matter of the form (/content/forms/contact.md). Of course, the example shown below (your@email.here) must not be used.
